paper_abstract: We study the problem of reconstructing a convex body using only a finite number of measurements of outer normal vectors. More precisely, we suppose that the normal vectors are measured at independent random locations uniformly distributed along the boundary of our convex set. Given a desired Hausdorff error eta, we provide upper bounds on the number of probes that one has to perform in order to obtain an eta-approximation of this convex set with high probability. Our result relies on the stability theory related to Minkowski's theorem.
paper_title: On the Reconstruction of Convex Sets from Random Normal Measurements
